entry.title: Small update to BIP 62
entry.summary: The conversation between Aaron Voisine and Gregory Maxwell revolves around Bitcoin transactions. Aaron suggests creating a transaction with a different signature hash by changing something trivial like nLockTime or order of inputs or outputs. He also talks about deterministic generation of k per RFC6979 to mitigate the possibility of new signatures by the sender. However, Gregory disagrees with Aaron's suggestion and asks him to explain why his idea won't work. The context suggests that they are discussing the technicalities of Bitcoin transactions and the use of elliptic curve math in signature generation.
